intro: Erysimum atticum, commonly known as the Greek wallflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features basal and stem leaves that are lanceolate in shape. Its flowers, which can be yellow, orange, or red, bloom in early spring. Erysimum atticum is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to Mediterranean climates.
